page.title: 09 Wellow Primary School.
page.content: Wellow school was founded by Florence Nightingale's mother and father who donated the land and money for the building in 1875.It was opened in May 1877 by the Rev.W.H.Epson. In 1976 a library was opened and in 1979 a new extension was built to house it. In 1985 a hall was added, a further extension and a garden opened. Florence Nightingale's clock and sewing machine were donated to the school.There are 314 pupils and 12 teachers in the school;the uniform is green,white and grey. The new part of the school is modern with a computer in most classrooms.The lessons are well organised and the pupils are attentive. By Sharron Brewer and Lisa Wareham.
